dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, I think a lot of people assume brain tumors are only an adult problem, but that's just not true.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, I think a lot of people assume brain tumors are only an adult problem, but that's just not true.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. Like this case at the National Center for Neurosurgery in Astana—a three-month-old girl had a massive tumor removed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. Like this case at the National Center for Neurosurgery in Astana-a three-month-old girl had a massive tumor removed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Doctors at the National Center for Neurosurgery in Astana have removed a massive brain tumor from a three-month-old girl, citing the Ministry of Healthcare's press service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the tumor was huge, like 5.6 by 4.2 centimeters. That's nearly half the baby's brain, which is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the tumor was huge, like five point six by four point two centimeters. That's nearly half the baby's brain, which is just staggering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An MRI later showed the tumor measured 5.6 by 4.2 centimeters. According to Gabit Olenbay, head of the pediatric neurosurgery department and professor, the operation was extremely difficult: the tumor occupied nearly half of the baby's brain, and the risk of blood loss was very high.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And she was only two months old when the symptoms started, right? Regurgitation, refusing to breastfeed...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And she was only two months old when the symptoms started, right? Regurgitation, refusing to breastfeed...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, at the age of two months, alarming symptoms began to appear: frequent regurgitation, refusal to breastfeed, cyanosis, and severe restlessness.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, her parents noticed something was really wrong. They acted fast, thank goodness. An ultrasound and CT scan confirmed it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, her parents noticed something was really wrong. They acted fast, thank goodness. An ultrasound and C T scan confirmed it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The parents of the girl, Aibat, immediately sought medical help. An ultrasound scan revealed a fluid-filled mass in the parieto-occipital region, and a CT scan confirmed a large mass in the left parietal lobe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then they brought in Professor Gabit Olenbay, head of pediatric neurosurgery there. He said the operation was extremely difficult because of the high risk of blood loss in such a tiny patient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then they brought in Professor Gabit Olenbay, head of pediatric neurosurgery there. He said the operation was extremely difficult because of the high risk of blood loss in such a tiny patient.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Gabit Olenbay, head of the pediatric neurosurgery department and professor, the operation was extremely difficult: the tumor occupied nearly half of the baby's brain, and the risk of blood loss was very high.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But they pulled it off with microsurgical techniques and teamwork. The mom was so emotional—she thanked the doctors, especially someone named Dmitriy Andreevich Surdin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they pulled it off with microsurgical techniques and teamwork. The mom was so emotional-she thanked the doctors, especially someone named Dmitriy Andreevich Surdin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We removed the tumor using microsurgical methods. I thank the doctors from the bottom of my heart, especially Dmitriy Andreevich Surdin and the entire medical staff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's amazing what modern medicine can do. And the anesthesiologists and transfusion specialists were crucial too—imagine monitoring a baby that young during surgery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's amazing what modern medicine can do. And the anesthesiologists and transfusion specialists were crucial too-imagine monitoring a baby that young during surgery.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Healthcare emphasized that anesthesiologists and transfusion specialists played a crucial role in the operation, as administering anesthesia and monitoring the condition of such a young patient requires extreme precision and care.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, it's all about precision. And now the baby's already doing better, no more regurgitation, improving overall.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, it's all about precision. And now the baby's already doing better, no more regurgitation, improving overall.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The girl is now undergoing postoperative treatment and already feels better. The regurgitation has stopped, and her overall condition has improved, said Gabit Olenbay.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: What a relief for the family. And you know, this isn't even the only major surgery happening in Kazakhstan—they just did their first triple kidney transplant too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What a relief for the family. And you know, this isn't even the only major surgery happening in Kazakhstan-they just did their first triple kidney transplant too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, President Tokayev congratulated Kazakh surgeons for performing the country's first triple kidney transplant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, President Tokayev congratulated the team. It's a good time for medical breakthroughs there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, President Tokayev congratulated the team. It's a good time for medical breakthroughs there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, President Tokayev congratulated Kazakh surgeons for performing the country's first triple kidney transplant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely gives you hope, stories like this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely gives you hope, stories like this.
